thread.title: Boston Red Sox prospect Yoan Moncada may not play in Puerto Rican Winter League (reports)
thread.title_full: Boston Red Sox prospect Yoan Moncada may not play in Puerto Rican Winter League (reports)

author: Jen McCaffrey | jmccaffr@masslive.com
title: Boston Red Sox prospect Yoan Moncada may not play in Puerto Rican Winter League (reports)
text:
Boston Red Sox prospect Yoan Moncada may not play in Puerto Rican Winter League (reports) Yoan Moncada Boston Red Sox' Yoan Moncada practices during spring training, Friday, March 13, 2015, in Fort Myers Fla. The Red Sox have finalized a minor league contract with 19-year-old Cuban infielder that includes a $31.5 million signing bonus, easily a record for an international amateur free agent under 23 years old. (AP Photo/Brynn Anderson) (Brynn Anderson ) Comments 
The Red Sox had planned to extend Yoan Moncada's terrific first professional season into winter ball, but that may be the case anymore. 
According to Rob Bradford at WEEI.com , Moncada's bruised hand, which he suffered during the fall instructional league, may prevent him from playing in Puerto Rico this winter. 
Moncada was scheduled to play for former major leaguer Alex Cora for Caguas, the team for which Rusney Castillo played last winter. 
In an article on the Caguas website , Moncada is scheduled to go to for an MRI on the hand. 
The 20-year-old Moncada hit .278/.380/.438 in 81 games for Single-A Greenville this season. 
Follow MassLive.com Red Sox beat reporter @jcmccaffrey on Twitter. She can be reached by email at jmccaffr@masslive.com .
